'''Abadeh''' ({{lang-fa| آباده }}) is a city in [[Fars Province|Fars province]], [[Iran]], situated at an elevation of {{convert|6200|ft|m|-1}} in a fertile plain on the high road between [[Isfahan (city)|Isfahan]] and [[Shiraz, Iran|Shiraz]], {{convert|140|mi|km}} from the former and {{convert|170|mi|km}} from the latter. The population is 95,460 (est. 2009),<ref>[http://www.gazetteer.de/c/c_ir.htm ''World Gazetteer'']</ref> showing a growth of 45% from 1985 to 2005. The city is the capital of [[Abadeh County|Abadehy County]].
It is the largest city in the [[Abadeh County|Abadeh]]-[[Eghlid]] district, which is famed for its carved wood-work, made of the wood of [[pear]] and [[box tree]]s. Sesame oil, castor oil, grain, and various fruits are also produced there. The area is famous for its [[Abadeh rug]]s.
==Landmarks and crafts== Abadeh historical monuments include Emirate Kolah Farangi, Tymcheh Sarafyan and Khaje tomb, located in the Khoja mountains. Abadeh crafts can be embroidered in cotton. The town also produces [[Abadeh rug]]s.
==Transportation==
'''[[Road 65 (Iran)|Expessway 65]]''' passes through Abadeh. This situation helps Abadeh to improve its capabilities. of course some problems such as dry climate absent of anatural potential make some problems for Abadeh. A road starts from Abadeh Ring Road to [[Soqad]] and [[Semirom]], [[Road 55 (Iran)|Road 55]].
A rail road from [[Isfahan]] to [[Shiraz]] was planned and started to be constructed in 2002. An airport was planned to be built in [[Akbar Hashemi Rafsenjani]]'s presidential period this airport is common between Eqlid and Abadeh.
